content:
Is it possible to set designations, properties or child concepts on concepts within a FSH CodeSystem definition?

I am assuming not. If not, are they on the roadmap?

Unfortunately, your assumption is correct. It is not possible to do this within the context of a FSH CodeSystem. It is possible to create an Instance of a CodeSystem, but this is not really a great solution, since you lose a lot of the shorthand that is the whole point of FHIR shorthand.

Yes, this is a task in our backlog, and multiple uses have run into this issue, so it is something we will prioritize.
Thanks @Nick Freiter - The issue came up as I generate FSH version of the 1000+ code systems in the R4 spec and clearly these features are used. Will watch with interest as FSH develops. :-)

The issue came up as I generate FSH version of the 1000+ code systems in the R4 spec

I assume this was an exercise, right? I mean, if you have an IG, you can reference any of the CodeSystems in the R4 spec via their canonical URL -- so there's no need to create FSH versions of them all...
Yeah - it was just a means to test the conversion process against a large set of CodeSystems
The same will be done for the ValueSets - once I understand the FSH syntax for these a bit better
